meanings.definition: (adjective) Cut from a log radially so that the growth rings are approximately perpendicular to the face of the board.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used quartersawn oak for the table, ensuring its durability.
meanings.sent2: The quartersawn wood displayed a beautiful pattern due to its unique cutting method.
meanings.sent3: The quartersawn planks stood proudly in the workshop, ready to be crafted into fine furniture.
meanings.sent4: The quartersawn timber whispered stories of the forest with each grain pattern.
meanings.sent5: The quartersawn lumber gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing its quality.

meanings.definition: (verb) To saw a log into quartersawn boards.
meanings.sent1: The sawmill workers quartersawn the logs efficiently to maximize the wood's strength.
meanings.sent2: He decided to quartersawn the timber to create unique patterns in the finished product.
meanings.sent3: As the saw buzzed, the log was quartersawn into perfect boards for the project.
meanings.sent4: She carefully quartersawned the wood, ensuring each board was of the highest quality.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter quartersawned the oak logs with precision, readying them for use.

meanings.definition: (noun) Wood that has been cut in a quartersawn manner.
meanings.sent1: The furniture maker preferred to work with quartersawn due to its stability.
meanings.sent2: The quartersawn displayed a unique grain pattern that set it apart from other cuts.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter's workshop was filled with the rich scent of quartersawn.
meanings.sent4: The table was crafted from beautiful quartersawn, showcasing the wood's quality.
meanings.sent5: The quartersawn planks were stacked neatly, awaiting their transformation into fine furniture.
